name: solidago ulmifolia
description: Elm-leaved Goldenrod is one of the shorter goldenrods.  Its height tops out at three feet.  It is found in medium to dry soils, and does best in shaded to semi-shaded situations.  The yellow flowers of Goldenrod are appreciated by the insects in the fall when they are getting ready for winter.
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
